p: This community has succeeded, in the absence of conservation interventions from without, in warding off loggers intent on plundering the areaâ€™s Pencil Cedar trees, and in regulating access by pastoralist communities to grazing in the forest during dry spells. The integrity of the forest has been widely respected as a result. And today, Mukogodo is extolled as a model of sustainable use, and of the capacity of local people to safeguard the forest resources on which they depend.
